summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: The Fifth Element (Remastered) [Blu-ray] Review Date: 2017/05/23 Store: Bruce Willis (Actor), Gary Oldman (Actor), Luc Besson (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Action & Adventure Product Description: ['Product Description', "New York cab driver Korben Dallas didn't mean to be a hero, but he just picked up the kind of fare that only comes along every five thousand years: A perfect beauty, a perfect being, a perfect weapon. Together, they must save the world. Bruce Willis, Milla Jovovich, and Gary Oldman star in acclaimed director Luc Besson's outrageous sci-fi adventure, an extravagantly styled tale of good against evil set in an unbelievable twenty-third century world. Now presented in full 4K resolution, experience this dynamic action favorite like never before.", 'Amazon.com', "Ancient curses, all-powerful monsters, shape-changing assassins, scantily-clad stewardesses, laser battles, huge explosions, a perfect woman, a malcontent hero--what more can you ask of a big-budget science fiction movie? Luc Besson's high-octane film incorporates presidents, rock stars, and cab drivers into its peculiar plot, traversing worlds and encountering some pretty wild aliens. Bruce Willis stars as a down-and-out cabbie who must win the love of Leeloo (Milla Jovovich) to save Earth from destruction by Jean-Baptiste Emmanuel Zorg (Gary Oldman) and a dark, unearthly force that makes Darth Vader look like an Ewok.", '--Geoff Riley'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Action, Sci-Fi', 'Format': 'Blu-ray, Subtitled, Dolby, Color, Widescreen, Anamorphic', 'Contributor': 'Gary Oldman, Bruce Willis, Milla Jovovich, Luc Besson, Ian Holm, Chris Tucker', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 6 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '6.75 x 5.25 x 0.3 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '3350191', 'Director': 'Luc Besson', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray, Subtitled, Dolby, Color, Widescreen, Anamorphic', 'Run time': '2 hours and 6 minutes', 'Release date': 'July 17, 2007', 'Actors': 'Bruce Willis, Gary Oldman, Ian Holm, Milla Jovovich, Chris Tucker', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French, Portuguese, Thai, Mandarin Chinese', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: Looks and sounds AMAZING. Best experience with this movie I've ever had. Seriously a well done remaster. Review Title: Looks and sounds AMAZING. Beasley', 'Mauri Syd Gayton', 'Daniel Grodnik', 'John Hughes', 'Tom Jacobson', 'Matty Simmons', 'Ramey E. Ward'], 'Starring': ['Chevy Chase', "Beverly D'Angelo", 'Juliette Lewis'], 'Studio': ['Warner Bros.']} Review Text: One of the Top 20 movies of any childhood. Review Title: Five Stars Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Westworld: The Complete First Season (BD) [Blu-ray] Review Date: 2019/09/12 Store: Various (Actor, Director) Format: Blu-ray Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, TV Product Description: ['Westworld: The Complete First Season (BD)', ']]>'] Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Science Fiction & Fantasy, Action & Adventure', 'Format': 'Blu-ray, Dolby, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Various', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Number Of Discs': '3', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 11.36 Ounces', 'Item model number': '0883929563678', 'Director': 'Various', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray, Dolby, NTSC', 'Run time': '11 hours and 15 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 7, 2017', 'Actors': 'Various', 'Studio': 'Studio Distribution Services', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '3'} Review Text: Glad I waited for Father's Day to get Season 1 and Season 2. This is a fantastic series, and having them on BluRay AND Digital to watch on my iPad makes me one happy camper. Definitely going to be a cult classic in about a decade. Review Title: Excellent Movie Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2020/08/15 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Danny DeVito'], 'Producers': ['Andrew Lazar', 'Peter Macgregor-Scott'], 'Starring': ['Robin Williams', 'Edward Norton', 'Catherine Keener'], 'Studio': ['WARNER BROS.']} Review Text: Wife decided we had to watch this movie ASAP, so we bought the streaming version. Wish there was a BluRay version at a reasonable price, but I guess we'll be able to watch this again as long as it's available online.

Great movie. It's a classic - Norton is fantastic, and Williams is an absolute gem. Review Title: Wish there was a BluRay Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2020/09/20 Average Rating: 4.0 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Dean Parisot'], 'Producers': ['Ray Bouderau', 'Courtney Chenn', 'Scott H. Cohen', 'Patrick W. Dugan', 'Scott Fischer', 'Elliot Grainge', 'Grant Guthrie', 'Brent Guttman', 'David Haring'], 'Starring': ['Keanu Reeves', 'Alex Winter', 'Kristen Schaal'], 'Studio': ['United Artist Releasing']} Review Text: This film is by far the best sequel a movie could ever have. Stays true to the roots of the originals with only a bit of retcon going on. Without giving anything away, the best character has to be Dennis. Wow...The whole family has been quoting this movie for a couple of weeks now. It's a must-watch if you're a fan of the originals. Such a good job. Review Title: Most excellent Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2020/09/30 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Michael Engler'], 'Producers': ['Gareth Neame', 'Julian Fellowes', 'Liz Trubridge', 'Nigel Marchant', 'Brian Percival'], 'Starring': ['Hugh Bonneville', 'Jim Carter', 'Michelle Dockery'], 'Studio': ['Focus Features']} Review Text: My wife started watching the series a few weeks back and once it was finished she just had to watch the movie. I mean..I kinda liked it. I was never a fan of soap operas, but this one isn't half bad. Review Title: Fine, I liked it. Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Flight of the Navigator Review Date: 2021/01/08 Store: Joey Cramer (Actor), Veronica Cartwright (Actor), Randal Kleiser (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Fantasy Product Description: ['Product Description', 'David Freeman (Joey Cramer) is an ordinary boy destined for a most extraordinary adventure -- aboard a spectacular, futuristic spacecraft. After a mystifying disappearance, David returns, possessing vast, undiscovered knowledge about the farthest reaches of the universe. With these sudden navigational powers, David is able to take the fantastic flying machine anywhere he desires, accompanied by both its wisecracking robotic commander, Max, and an assortment of bizarre extraterrestrial creatures! Embark on a fun-filled, fast-paced journey of fantasy and adventure as David takes off on the flight of a lifetime! Also featuring Sarah Jessica Parker and the voice of Paul Reubens.|The movie was filmed in Broward County, Florida, and, at the other extreme, Norway.|Sarah Jessica Parker makes one of her first film appearances in this 1986 flick.|Paul Reubens (Pee-wee Herman) stars as the voice of Max, a wisecracking robotic spaceship commander.', 'Amazon.com', "Disney's 1986", 'Flight of the Navigator', "combines a strong ensemble cast and classic '80s soundtrack with dazzling special effects for a high-flying sci-fi adventure. While searching for his little brother in the woods, 12-year-old David Freeman (Joey Cramer) falls down a ravine and is knocked unconscious. After what seems like minutes, he returns home, only to discover that eight years have passed since he was declared missing and presumed dead. Even more mystifying is that David hasn't aged, nor can he account for the time lapse. Meanwhile, NASA officials stumble upon a futuristic spacecraft and are determined to assess what David knows about it by locking him in a top-secret lab for scanning and testing. His only chance of escape is in the spacecraft manned by Max, a wisecracking robot. Cramer gives an earnest performance, which overcomes an imperfect script, while enough one-liners and imaginative animation will keep families engaged. Watch for Sarah Jessica Parker in one of her first film appearances. Rated PG for language. (Ages 6 and older)", '--Lynn Gibson'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Genre': 'ACTION, Action/Adventure, LIVE', 'Format': 'Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Surround Sound, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Richard Liberty, Sarah Jessica Parker, Brigid Cleary, Michael Burton, Cliff De Young, Paul Reubens, Veronica Cartwright, Ted Bartsch, Michael Strano, Cynthia Caquelin, Raymond Forchion, Gizelle Elliot, Robert Small, Matt Adler, Jonathan Sanger, Matt MacManus, Howard Hesseman, Albie Whitaker, Iris Acker, Randal Kleiser, Joey CramerRichard Liberty, Sarah Jessica Parker, Brigid Cleary, Michael Burton, Cliff De Young, Paul Reubens, Veronica Cartwright, Ted Bartsch, Michael Strano, Cynthia Caquelin, Raymond Forchion, Gizelle Elliot, Robert Small, Matt Adler, Jonathan Sanger, Matt MacManus, Howar… See more', 'Language': 'Unqualified, English (Dolby Surround)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 30 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.5 x 7.5 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '2259724', 'Director': 'Randal Kleiser', 'Media Format': 'Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Surround Sound, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 30 minutes', 'Release date': 'June 1, 2004', 'Actors': 'Joey Cramer, Veronica Cartwright, Cliff De Young, Sarah Jessica Parker, Matt Adler', 'Subtitles': 'French, Spanish', 'Studio': 'WALT DISNEY PICTURES', 'Writers': 'Michael Burton, Matt MacManus', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: This is one of those movies I watch at least once a year. An all-time favorite. David gets sent to the future...He's obviously the same, but his family has aged. Travels across the globe with the assistance of a sentient spacecraft voiced by Peewee. What's not to like? Review Title: Top 10 Movies Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Galaxy Quest (Widescreen Edition) [DVD] Review Date: 2021/01/08 Store: Tim Allen (Actor), Sigourney Weaver (Actor), Dean Parisot (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Science Fiction, Comedy Product Description: ['Product Description', 'For four years, the courageous crew of the NSEA Protector - "Commander Peter Quincy Taggart" (Tim Allen), "Lt. Tawny Madison" (Sigourney Weaver) and "Dr. Lazarus" (Alan Rickman) - set off on thrilling and often dangerous missions in space . . . and then their series was canceled!', 'Now, twenty years later, aliens under attack have mistaken the', 'Galaxy Quest', 'television transmissions for "historical documents" and beamed up the crew of has-been actors to save the universe. With no script, no director and no clue, the actors must turn in the performances of their lives in this hilarious adventure Jeffery Lyons (NBC-TV) calls "The funniest, wittiest comedy of the year."', 'Amazon.com', "You don't have to be a", 'Star Trek', 'fan to enjoy', 'Galaxy Quest', ', but it certainly helps. A knowingly affectionate tribute to', 'Trek', "and any other science fiction TV series of the 1960s and beyond, this crowd-pleasing comedy offers in-jokes at warp speed, hitting the bull's-eye for anyone who knows that (1)\xa0the starship captain always removes his shirt to display his manly physique; (2)\xa0any crew member not in the regular cast is dead meat; and (3)\xa0the heroes always stop the doomsday clock with one second to spare. So it is with Commander Taggart (Tim Allen) and the stalwart crew of the NSEA", 'Protector', ", whose intergalactic exploits on TV have now been reduced to a dreary cycle of fan conventions and promotional appearances. That's when the Thermians arrive, begging to be saved from Sarris, the reptilian villain who threatens to destroy their home planet.", 'Can actors rise to the challenge and play their roles for real? The Thermians are counting on it, having studied the "historical documents" of the', 'Galaxy Quest', 'TV show, and their hero worship (not to mention their taste for Monte Cristo sandwiches) is ultimately proven worthy, with the help of some', 'Galaxy', 'geeks on planet Earth. And while', 'Galaxy Quest', 'serves up great special effects and impressive Stan Winston creatures, director Dean Parisot (', 'Home Fries', ') is never condescending, lending warm acceptance to this gentle send-up of sci-fi TV and the phenomenon of fandom. Best of all is the splendid cast, including Sigourney Weaver as buxom blonde Gwen DeMarco; Alan Rickman as frustrated thespian Alexander Dane; Tony Shalhoub as dimwit Fred Kwan; Daryl Mitchell as former child-star Tommy Webber; and Enrico Colantoni as Thermian leader Mathesar, whose sing-song voice is a comedic coup de grâce.', '--Jeff Shannon'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Action & Adventure', 'Format': 'Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, DVD, NTSC, Widescreen, Surround Sound', 'Contributor': 'Dean Parisot, Tim Allen, Alan Rickman, Sigourney Weaver', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 42 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.35:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.55 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Director': 'Dean Parisot', 'Media Format': 'Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, DVD, NTSC, Widescreen, Surround Sound', 'Run time': '1 hour and 42 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 2, 2000', 'Actors': 'Tim Allen, Sigourney Weaver, Alan Rickman', 'Studio': 'Dreamworks Video', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: Just a classic! One of the greatest semi-parody space movies ever made. Rivals the actual films and TV series it is mocking. If you haven't seen it, get it. Review Title: Not a cult classic.. Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Idiocracy Review Date: 2021/01/08 Store: Luke Wilson (Actor), Maya Rudolph (Actor), Mike Judge (Director, Writer) & 0 more Rated: R Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Science Fiction, Comedy Product Description: ['Product Description', "Meet Joe Bowers (Luke Wilson). He's not the sharpest tool in the shed. But when a government hibernation experiment goes awry, Bowers awakens in the year 2505 to find a society so dumbed down by mass commercialism and mindless TV programming that he's become the smartest guy on the planet. Now it's up to an average Joe to get human evolution back on track.", 'Amazon.com', 'Given that', 'Office Space', "is a bona fide cult classic, it comes as some surprise that Mike Judge's follow-up wasn't more heavily promoted. Granted, this live-action comedy is a darker, more pointed proposition, but it's unfortunate that few theater patrons got the opportunity to, well, judge for themselves. In", 'Idiocracy', ', the', 'King of the Hill', 'creator visualizes what would happen if Devo\'s proposition--that mankind is in the process of devolution--came to pass. The catalyst: the overeducated start having fewer children while the undereducated have more. Enter Joe (Luke Wilson), a military librarian with no family and even less ambition. The Pentagon chooses him for a top-secret hibernation project due to his extreme "average-ness." They select Rita (', 'SNL', "'s Maya Rudolph), a prostitute, for the same reason. When the experiment goes haywire, the two emerge 500 years later--rather than one. Now it's 2505 and they're the brightest people in the over-polluted land. Everyone else is, basically, Beavis and Butt-head. Yes, the satire couldn't be less subtle, but the premise gives Judge license to make as much fun of junk food pop culture as dystopian classics like", '1984', 'and', 'Planet of the Apes', '. Wilson wisely plays it straight, even if the actors who surround him sometimes succumb to excess. And the effects may be cheesy, but that just adds to the fun.', 'Idiocracy', 'features former footballer Terry Crews (', 'Everybody Hates Chris', ') as President Camacho and Dax Shepard (', "Punk'd", ") as Joe's futuristic friend Frito.", '--Kathleen C. Fennessy'] Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'AC-3, Color, Multiple Formats, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Widescreen, Subtitled', 'Contributor': "Dax Shepard, Maya Rudolph, Luke Wilson, Kevin McAfee, Terry Crews, Mike Judge, Etan Cohen, Michael McCafferty, David Herman, Anthony 'Citric' Campos, Justin Long, Robert Musgrave, Christopher Ryan, Sonny CastilloDax Shepard, Maya Rudolph, Luke Wilson, Kevin McAfee, Terry Crews, Mike Judge, Etan Cohen, Michael McCafferty, David Herman, Anthony 'Citric' Campos, Justin Long, Robert Musgrave, Christopher Ryan, Sonny Castillo See more", 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Unqualified, Spanish (Dolby Digital 2.1)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 24 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.57 x 5.39 x 7.49 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '2240179', 'Director': 'Mike Judge', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Color, Multiple Formats, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Widescreen, Subtitled', 'Run time': '1 hour and 24 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 9, 2007', 'Actors': "Luke Wilson, Maya Rudolph, Dax Shepard, Terry Crews, Anthony 'Citric' Campos", 'Dubbed': 'English, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French', 'Studio': '20th Century Fox', 'Writers': 'Etan Cohen, Mike Judge', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: When this was made, it was a satire on how things were going. Weird how accurate this is turning out to be. More of a documentary than a comedy movie. Review Title: Disturbingly accurate. Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2021/10/27 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Stanley Donen'], 'Producers': ['Jack Cummings'], 'Starring': ['Jane Powell', 'Howard Keel', 'Jeff Richards'], 'Studio': ['MGM']} Review Text: I’m not a fan, but my wife loves the movie. Review Title: Not a fan, myself. Rating: 4.0 --------------------------------------------------

Also featuring Sarah Jessica Parker and the voice of Paul Reubens.|The movie was filmed in Broward County, Florida, and, at the other extreme, Norway.|Sarah Jessica Parker makes one of her first film appearances in this 1986 flick.|Paul Reubens (Pee-wee Herman) stars as the voice of Max, a wisecracking robotic spaceship commander.', 'Amazon.com', "Disney's 1986", 'Flight of the Navigator', "combines a strong ensemble cast and classic '80s soundtrack with dazzling special effects for a high-flying sci-fi adventure. While searching for his little brother in the woods, 12-year-old David Freeman (Joey Cramer) falls down a ravine and is knocked unconscious. After what seems like minutes, he returns home, only to discover that eight years have passed since he was declared missing and presumed dead. Even more mystifying is that David hasn't aged, nor can he account for the time lapse. Meanwhile, NASA officials stumble upon a futuristic spacecraft and are determined to assess what David knows about it by locking him in a top-secret lab for scanning and testing. His only chance of escape is in the spacecraft manned by Max, a wisecracking robot. Cramer gives an earnest performance, which overcomes an imperfect script, while enough one-liners and imaginative animation will keep families engaged. Watch for Sarah Jessica Parker in one of her first film appearances. Rated PG for language. Top 10 Movies Galaxy Quest (Widescreen Edition) [DVD] Tim Allen (Actor), Sigourney Weaver (Actor), Dean Parisot (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: DVD Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Science Fiction, Comedy ['Product Description', 'For four years, the courageous crew of the NSEA Protector - "Commander Peter Quincy Taggart" (Tim Allen), "Lt. Tawny Madison" (Sigourney Weaver) and "Dr. Lazarus" (Alan Rickman) - set off on thrilling and often dangerous missions in space . . . and then their series was canceled!', 'Now, twenty years later, aliens under attack have mistaken the', 'Galaxy Quest', 'television transmissions for "historical documents" and beamed up the crew of has-been actors to save the universe. With no script, no director and no clue, the actors must turn in the performances of their lives in this hilarious adventure Jeffery Lyons (NBC-TV) calls "The funniest, wittiest comedy of the year."', 'Amazon.com', "You don't have to be a", 'Star Trek', 'fan to enjoy', 'Galaxy Quest', ', but it certainly helps. A knowingly affectionate tribute to', 'Trek', "and any other science fiction TV series of the 1960s and beyond, this crowd-pleasing comedy offers in-jokes at warp speed, hitting the bull's-eye for anyone who knows that (1)\xa0the starship captain always removes his shirt to display his manly physique; (2)\xa0any crew member not in the regular cast is dead meat; and (3)\xa0the heroes always stop the doomsday clock with one second to spare. So it is with Commander Taggart (Tim Allen) and the stalwart crew of the NSEA", 'Protector', ", whose intergalactic exploits on TV have now been reduced to a dreary cycle of fan conventions and promotional appearances. That's when the Thermians arrive, begging to be saved from Sarris, the reptilian villain who threatens to destroy their home planet.", 'Can actors rise to the challenge and play their roles for real? The Thermians are counting on it, having studied the "historical documents" of the', 'Galaxy Quest', 'TV show, and their hero worship (not to mention their taste for Monte Cristo sandwiches) is ultimately proven worthy, with the help of some', 'Galaxy', 'geeks on planet Earth. And while', 'Galaxy Quest', 'serves up great special effects and impressive Stan Winston creatures, director Dean Parisot (', 'Home Fries', ') is never condescending, lending warm acceptance to this gentle send-up of sci-fi TV and the phenomenon of fandom. Best of all is the splendid cast, including Sigourney Weaver as buxom blonde Gwen DeMarco; Alan Rickman as frustrated thespian Alexander Dane; Tony Shalhoub as dimwit Fred Kwan; Daryl Mitchell as former child-star Tommy Webber; and Enrico Colantoni as Thermian leader Mathesar, whose sing-song voice is a comedic coup de grâce.', '--Jeff Shannon'] {'Genre': 'Action & Adventure', 'Format': 'Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, DVD, NTSC, Widescreen, Surround Sound', 'Contributor': 'Dean Parisot, Tim Allen, Alan Rickman, Sigourney Weaver', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 42 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.35:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.55 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Director': 'Dean Parisot', 'Media Format': 'Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, DVD, NTSC, Widescreen, Surround Sound', 'Run time': '1 hour and 42 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 2, 2000', 'Actors': 'Tim Allen, Sigourney Weaver, Alan Rickman', 'Studio': 'Dreamworks Video', 'Number of discs': '1'} Just a classic! Idiocracy Luke Wilson (Actor), Maya Rudolph (Actor), Mike Judge (Director, Writer) & 0 more Rated: R Format: DVD Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Science Fiction, Comedy ['Product Description', "Meet Joe Bowers (Luke Wilson). He's not the sharpest tool in the shed. But when a government hibernation experiment goes awry, Bowers awakens in the year 2505 to find a society so dumbed down by mass commercialism and mindless TV programming that he's become the smartest guy on the planet. Now it's up to an average Joe to get human evolution back on track.", 'Amazon.com', 'Given that', 'Office Space', "is a bona fide cult classic, it comes as some surprise that Mike Judge's follow-up wasn't more heavily promoted. Granted, this live-action comedy is a darker, more pointed proposition, but it's unfortunate that few theater patrons got the opportunity to, well, judge for themselves. In", 'Idiocracy', ', the', 'King of the Hill', 'creator visualizes what would happen if Devo\'s proposition--that mankind is in the process of devolution--came to pass. The catalyst: the overeducated start having fewer children while the undereducated have more. Enter Joe (Luke Wilson), a military librarian with no family and even less ambition. The Pentagon chooses him for a top-secret hibernation project due to his extreme "average-ness." They select Rita (', 'SNL', "'s Maya Rudolph), a prostitute, for the same reason. When the experiment goes haywire, the two emerge 500 years later--rather than one. Now it's 2505 and they're the brightest people in the over-polluted land. Everyone else is, basically, Beavis and Butt-head. Yes, the satire couldn't be less subtle, but the premise gives Judge license to make as much fun of junk food pop culture as dystopian classics like", '1984', 'and', 'Planet of the Apes', '. Wilson wisely plays it straight, even if the actors who surround him sometimes succumb to excess. And the effects may be cheesy, but that just adds to the fun.', 'Idiocracy', 'features former footballer Terry Crews (', 'Everybody Hates Chris', ') as President Camacho and Dax Shepard (', "Punk'd", ") as Joe's futuristic friend Frito.", '--Kathleen C. Fennessy'] {'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'AC-3, Color, Multiple Formats, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Widescreen, Subtitled', 'Contributor': "Dax Shepard, Maya Rudolph, Luke Wilson, Kevin McAfee, Terry Crews, Mike Judge, Etan Cohen, Michael McCafferty, David Herman, Anthony 'Citric' Campos, Justin Long, Robert Musgrave, Christopher Ryan, Sonny CastilloDax Shepard, Maya Rudolph, Luke Wilson, Kevin McAfee, Terry Crews, Mike Judge, Etan Cohen, Michael McCafferty, David Herman, Anthony 'Citric' Campos, Justin Long, Robert Musgrave, Christopher Ryan, Sonny Castillo See more", 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Unqualified, Spanish (Dolby Digital 2.1)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 24 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.57 x 5.39 x 7.49 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '2240179', 'Director': 'Mike Judge', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Color, Multiple Formats, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Widescreen, Subtitled', 'Run time': '1 hour and 24 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 9, 2007', 'Actors': "Luke Wilson, Maya Rudolph, Dax Shepard, Terry Crews, Anthony 'Citric' Campos", 'Dubbed': 'English, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French', 'Studio': '20th Century Fox', 'Writers': 'Etan Cohen, Mike Judge', 'Number of discs': '1'} When this was made, it was a satire on how things were going. Weird how accurate this is turning out to be. More of a documentary than a comedy movie. Disturbingly accurate. {'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Stanley Donen'], 'Producers': ['Jack Cummings'], 'Starring': ['Jane Powell', 'Howard Keel', 'Jeff Richards'], 'Studio': ['MGM']} I’m not a fan, but my wife loves the movie. Not a fan, myself.

Together, they must save the world. Bruce Willis, Milla Jovovich, and Gary Oldman star in acclaimed director Luc Besson's outrageous sci-fi adventure, an extravagantly styled tale of good against evil set in an unbelievable twenty-third century world. Now presented in full 4K resolution, experience this dynamic action favorite like never before.", 'Amazon.com', "Ancient curses, all-powerful monsters, shape-changing assassins, scantily-clad stewardesses, laser battles, huge explosions, a perfect woman, a malcontent hero--what more can you ask of a big-budget science fiction movie? Luc Besson's high-octane film incorporates presidents, rock stars, and cab drivers into its peculiar plot, traversing worlds and encountering some pretty wild aliens. Bruce Willis stars as a down-and-out cabbie who must win the love of Leeloo (Milla Jovovich) to save Earth from destruction by Jean-Baptiste Emmanuel Zorg (Gary Oldman) and a dark, unearthly force that makes Darth Vader look like an Ewok.", '--Geoff Riley'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Action, Sci-Fi', 'Format': 'Blu-ray, Subtitled, Dolby, Color, Widescreen, Anamorphic', 'Contributor': 'Gary Oldman, Bruce Willis, Milla Jovovich, Luc Besson, Ian Holm, Chris Tucker', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 6 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '6.75 x 5.25 x 0.3 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '3350191', 'Director': 'Luc Besson', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray, Subtitled, Dolby, Color, Widescreen, Anamorphic', 'Run time': '2 hours and 6 minutes', 'Release date': 'July 17, 2007', 'Actors': 'Bruce Willis, Gary Oldman, Ian Holm, Milla Jovovich, Chris Tucker', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French, Portuguese, Thai, Mandarin Chinese', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: Looks and sounds AMAZING. When the experiment goes haywire, the two emerge 500 years later--rather than one. Now it's 2505 and they're the brightest people in the over-polluted land. Everyone else is, basically, Beavis and Butt-head. Yes, the satire couldn't be less subtle, but the premise gives Judge license to make as much fun of junk food pop culture as dystopian classics like", '1984', 'and', 'Planet of the Apes', '. Wilson wisely plays it straight, even if the actors who surround him sometimes succumb to excess. And the effects may be cheesy, but that just adds to the fun.', 'Idiocracy', 'features former footballer Terry Crews (', 'Everybody Hates Chris', ') as President Camacho and Dax Shepard (', "Punk'd", ") as Joe's futuristic friend Frito.", '--Kathleen C. Fennessy'] Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'AC-3, Color, Multiple Formats, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Widescreen, Subtitled', 'Contributor': "Dax Shepard, Maya Rudolph, Luke Wilson, Kevin McAfee, Terry Crews, Mike Judge, Etan Cohen, Michael McCafferty, David Herman, Anthony 'Citric' Campos, Justin Long, Robert Musgrave, Christopher Ryan, Sonny CastilloDax Shepard, Maya Rudolph, Luke Wilson, Kevin McAfee, Terry Crews, Mike Judge, Etan Cohen, Michael McCafferty, David Herman, Anthony 'Citric' Campos, Justin Long, Robert Musgrave, Christopher Ryan, Sonny Castillo See more", 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Unqualified, Spanish (Dolby Digital 2.1)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 24 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.57 x 5.39 x 7.49 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '2240179', 'Director': 'Mike Judge', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Color, Multiple Formats, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Widescreen, Subtitled', 'Run time': '1 hour and 24 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 9, 2007', 'Actors': "Luke Wilson, Maya Rudolph, Dax Shepard, Terry Crews, Anthony 'Citric' Campos", 'Dubbed': 'English, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French', 'Studio': '20th Century Fox', 'Writers': 'Etan Cohen, Mike Judge', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: When this was made, it was a satire on how things were going. Weird how accurate this is turning out to be. More of a documentary than a comedy movie. Review Title: Disturbingly accurate. Review Title: Not a fan, myself. Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- Format your response exactly as follows: POSITIVE SUMMARY: [Your positive summary here] NEGATIVE SUMMARY: [Your negative summary here] OVERALL SUMMARY: [Your overall summary here]
raw_response:
POSITIVE SUMMARY:
The user has consistently enjoyed high-quality cinematic experiences, particularly with remastered classics that offer impressive audio-visual enhancements. There is a notable appreciation for films that evoke nostalgia and engage the viewer with deep characters and exciting plots. Many purchases reflect a strong emotional connection to childhood favorites, and the user frequently expresses joy in sharing these films with family. A recurring theme is the satisfaction derived from owning well-produced Blu-rays that facilitate enjoyable viewing on multiple devices, enhancing overall satisfaction with the purchases.

NEGATIVE SUMMARY:
Despite the predominantly positive experiences, there are hints of frustration regarding the availability of certain formats at reasonable prices, particularly a desire for more Blu-ray versions of favored classic films. There are moments of disappointment when the user feels they have settled for streaming options rather than preferred physical formats. Additionally, some reviews indicate a lack of enthusiasm for genres that do not align with personal taste, which is evidenced by reluctance to engage with series or films outside of established favorites.

OVERALL SUMMARY:
The user's purchase history reveals a strong penchant for quality films and nostalgic titles, underscored by high ratings and affirmative reviews. Positive experiences are amplified by the enjoyment derived from vast cinematic journeys and emotional connections to childhood memories. However, some frustration exists regarding the limited availability of desirable formats and occasional disinterest in specific genres. Overall, this reflects a dedicated film enthusiast who values both the accessibility of films and the tactile experience of physical media.

target_interaction.title: It’s not as wild of a ride these days.
target_interaction.text: A classic that didn’t hold up to the test of time.  Still good for a laugh, but comes off as way more campy than younger me remembered.  My kids thought it was hilarious.
